title: tldraw - very good whiteboard SDK / infinite canvas SDK
author: tldraw team
notes: Mature infinite canvas SDK with built-in shape management, keyboard shortcuts, and extensive documentation. Commercial license required to remove attribution watermark.

title: React Flow - Node-Based UIs in React
author: xyflow team
notes: MIT-licensed React library for node-based diagrams with automatic layouts, drag & drop, and extensible components. Strong ecosystem but requires custom keyboard navigation implementation.

title: Konva - JavaScript Canvas 2d Library
author: Konva Community
notes: High-performance 2D canvas library with object-oriented API, animations, and cross-platform support. Framework agnostic but requires building infinite canvas system from scratch.

title: PixiJS - The HTML5 Creation Engine
author: PixiJS Team
notes: WebGL-accelerated 2D renderer used by major brands. Exceptional performance for complex graphics but may be overkill for simple diagramming applications.

title: GoJS - Interactive Diagrams for the Web in JavaScript and TypeScript
author: Northwoods Software
notes: Professional diagramming library with built-in layouts, keyboard shortcuts, and extensive documentation. Commercial license required, used by enterprise clients like NASA and Amazon.

title: Excalidraw - Virtual whiteboard for sketching hand-drawn like diagrams
author: Excalidraw Community
notes: Open-source virtual whiteboard with infinite canvas, hand-drawn aesthetics, and real-time collaboration. MIT licensed but designed as full application rather than reusable library.

title: Canvas API - Web APIs | MDN
author: MDN Contributors
notes: Official documentation for native HTML5 Canvas API. Provides foundation for custom implementations with full control over rendering and interactions.
